results.title: Flying skis. [Fishing]
results.brief_description: 1. ‘Flying skis’ looks at ice-skating, figure skating and ski joring. The Scandinavian sport of ski joring combines the skills of a cowboy with those of a skier whereby skiers are towed behind a horse. Alex Foster, ex-Olympian skier, captain of the Canadian ski team and inventor of the tow rope and ski-lift, demonstrates the fancy skiing style that he developed which combines down-hill skiing and figure skating techniques. 2. ‘Fishing’ captures the thrill and excitement that lures anglers to fresh and saltwater fishing. Introduces a range of innovative techniques including fishing with dogs and donkeys, casting a line with the aid of a parachute, Georgian swamp fishing without equipment and catching Arkansaw monster Garfish. Also shows more conventional fishing methods including Silvery Salmon; Marlin fishing off the Australian coast and Tuna fishing in Nova Scotia.

results.title: Flying seeds
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.

results.title: Flying over the Shoalhaven River
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
Margaret Preston was one of the few artists who have attempted to absorb the spirit of Australian aboriginal art into Modernist painting. “Flying over the Shoalhaven River” is one of the best of her paintings influenced by the ancient art of this country. The film examines some of the artist’s work, and her thoughts on “National Art”, design and theories of light and colour are also elaborated.

results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: Melanie Coombs, AFTRS and Michael James Rowland
results.brief_description: A Soviet cosmonaut is hurtling through space in a malfunctioning space craft and as he faces his death he remembers his childhood on the Russian steppes where he first became aware of the beauty and miracle of flight. Through the eyes of one individual this delightful Australian short encapsulates the massive movement of modern Russian history from feudal peasantry to technological advancement.

results.title: Flying leathernecks
results.creator_credit: Edmund Grainger, RKO Radio Pictures and Nicholas Ray
results.brief_description: Major Dan Kirby (John Wayne) heads a marine fighter squadron in the South Pacific in 1942. The men in the squadron resent his leadership due to the fact that they expected one of their own to be promoted - and so a clash of personalities ensues. When the squadron is sent to Guadalcanal to give support to ground troops, Kirby is further hindered by a dangerous shortage of planes and pilots. Real-life footage and staged action combine to make this one of the most unforgettable war films of the 1950s.

results.title: Flying elephants
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Kodak Cinegraph and Fred J. Butler
results.brief_description: Set in the Stone Age when men were forced to marry and then work on the rock pile - that’s why it was called the “Stone Age!”. King Ferdinand has ordered that all men between the ages of 13 and 95 must be married within 21 days or be executed or banished for life, or both. Amongst those vying for a wife are the big husky caveman known as the Mighty Giant (Oliver Hardy) and his rival, Twinkle Star (Stan Laurel).

results.title: Flying Dutchmen
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
65 year old Jan van Hulsen teams up Fred van`t Riet to sail a 37 foot yacht from Guatemala to Australia. Hindered by poor weather, delays and clashes of opinion, they don’t travel much further than the Caribbean. Still grieving the recent death of his wife, Jan perseveres through the loneliness and hardship to chart a new direction in his life.

results.title: Flying down to Rio
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Thornton Freeland
results.brief_description: This wonderful nostalgic film celebrates not only the Hollywood musical but more importantly and historically, it was also the first film that Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire teamed together and set the world alight with their magical dance movements. On-screen dancing would never be the same again. Electrifying, mesmerising, Rogers and Astaire outshone even the top-billed stars Dolores Del Rio, Gene Raymond and Raul Roulien. Forget the plot, just enjoy the whole musical experience.

results.title: Flying doctor
results.brief_description: A factual film of a unique Australian service: “By aeroplane and radio the Flying Doctor Service and the Commonwealth Air Ambulance Service bring medical aid to the thinly populated areas of Australia’s vast inland. At Broken Hill base, where this film as photographed, Dr John Wood cares for patients in an area of over 500,000 square miles”. Photography by Lionel Trainor.
